intro: Cercostylos scabiosoides, commonly known as the hairy pearly everlasting, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant has hairy stems and leaves, which help it retain moisture in arid environments. It typically grows in dry, open habitats such as meadows and rocky slopes. Cercostylos scabiosoides is often used in ornamental gardening due to its long-lasting blooms and drought tolerance.
